location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the back of the file. Circled serial numbers (red for received correspondence; blue/black for issued correspondence) refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file.
Foliation: the foliation system in use appears in pencil in the top right hand corner of each folio, starting with the first document in the file, and continuing to the back cover.

mods.abstract: The file includes papers relating to a request by Hamid (generally so spelled in correspondence) bin Malik for a pay increase or free rations, which resulted in his being awarded a pay rise, March 1945; and a request from him for four months' leave, which according to the notes at the rear of the file was granted, April to May 1946.
